Following a request by ORG for information as to the existing remedies at the material time in respect of complaints concerning conditions of detention in centres for illegal immigrants , ORG stated that pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW , it could receive complaints regarding any issue . It also noted that the domestic law did not explicitly provide for a right to complain about conditions of detention ; nevertheless , applicants could avail themselves of the right to submit a complaint by virtue of ORG ( “ ORG iesniegumu , sūdzību un priekšlikumu izskatīšanas kārtību valsts un pašvaldību institūcijās ” ) . In response to a similar request ORG replied that questions concerning the arrest and detention of persons did not fall within its sphere of competence .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the law provides that an official of ORG has the right to detain an alien :
( CARDINAL ) if he or she has illegally crossed the State border of GPE or otherwise violated the procedures prescribed by regulatory enactments for the entry into and residence of aliens in GPE ;
( CARDINAL ) if the alien poses a threat to ORG security and public order ;
( CARDINAL ) in order to implement an order regarding removal of an alien from GPE .
As a result of the amendments of DATE , which became effective as from DATE , section DATE was subjected to merely textual changes .
CARDINAL . By section CARDINAL ) , an official of ORG has the right to detain an alien for a period not exceeding DATE in the cases referred to in section CARDINAL of the law .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that in defence of their legitimate interests , foreign detainees have the right to appeal to ORG , to contact a consular institution of their own country and to receive legal assistance . Aliens must be informed of these rights at the time of their detention .
